1.brief: intercession, supplication; by implication, a hymn
David, the youngest son of Jesse
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
the right (natural, moral or legal); also (abstractly) equity or (figuratively) prosperity
to prick up the ears, i.e. hearken
properly, a creaking (or shrill sound), i.e. shout (of joy or grief)
to broaden out the ear (with the hand), i.e. (by implication) to listen
intercession, supplication; by implication, a hymn
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
the lip (as a natural boundary); by implication, language; by analogy, a margin (of a vessel, water, cloth, etc.)

2.brief: the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)

properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style
to go (causatively, bring) out, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively, direct and proxim.
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
to gaze at; mentally to perceive, contemplate (with pleasure); specifically, to have avision of
evenness, i.e. (figuratively) prosperity or concord; also straightness, i.e. (figuratively) rectitude (only in plural with singular sense; often adverbially)

3.brief: to test (especially metals); generally and figuratively, to investigate
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
to visit (with friendly or hostile intent); by analogy, to oversee, muster, charge, care for, miss, deposit, etc.
properly, a twist (away of the light), i.e. night; figuratively, adversity
to fuse (metal), i.e. refine (literally or figuratively)
properly, a failure; by implication nothing; usually (adverb) not at all; also lest
properly, to come forth to, i.e. appear or exist; transitively, to attain, i.e. find or acquire; figuratively, to occur, meet or be present
to plan, usually in a bad sense
properly, a failure; by implication nothing; usually (adverb) not at all; also lest
to cross over; used very widely of any transition (literal or figurative; transitive, intransitive, intensive, causative); specifically, to cover (in copulation)
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to

4.brief: ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)
a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause
the lip (as a natural boundary); by implication, language; by analogy, a margin (of a vessel, water, cloth, etc.)
properly, to hedge about (as with thorns), i.e. guard; generally, to protect, attend to, etc.
a well-trodden road (literally or figuratively); also a caravan

5.brief: to sustain; by implication, to obtain, keep fast; figuratively, to help, follow close
a track (literally or figuratively); also a rampart (as circular)
properly, a failure; by implication nothing; usually (adverb) not at all; also lest
to waver; by implication, to slip, shake, fall
a stroke, literally or figuratively (in various applications, as follow)

6.brief: to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
properly, to eye or (generally) to heed, i.e. pay attention; by implication, to respond; by extension to begin to speak; specifically to sing, shout, testify, announce
strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)
to stretch or spread out; by implication, to bend away (including moral deflection); used in a great variety of application
broadness. i.e. (concrete) the ear (from its form in man)
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)

7.brief: kindness; by implication (towards God) piety; rarely (by opposition) reproof, or (subject.) beauty
properly, to be open, wide or free, i.e. (by implication) to be safe; causatively, to free or succor
to flee for protection; figuratively, to confide in
to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative)
the right hand or side (leg, eye) of a person or other object (as the stronger and more dexterous); locally, the south

8.brief: properly, to hedge about (as with thorns), i.e. guard; generally, to protect, attend to, etc.
the little man of the eye; the pupil or ball; hence, the middle (of night)
a daughter (used in the same wide sense as other terms of relationship, literally and figuratively)
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
an edge or extremity; specifically (of a bird or army) a wing, (of a garment or bedclothing) a flap, (of the earth) a quarter, (of a building) a pinnacle
to hide (by covering), literally or figuratively

9.brief: the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
properly, to be burly, i.e. (figuratively) powerful (passively, impregnable); by implication, to ravage
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
to strike with more or less violence (beat, fell, corrode); by implication (of attack) to knock together, i.e. surround or circulate
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications

10.brief: fat, whether literally or figuratively; hence, the richest or choice part
to shut up; figuratively, to surrender
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to
perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue

11.brief: at this time, whether adverb, conjunction or expletive
to revolve, surround, or border; used in various applications, literally and figuratively
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
to place (in a very wide application)
to stretch or spread out; by implication, to bend away (including moral deflection); used in a great variety of application
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

12.brief: properly, to become pale, i.e. (by implication) to pine after; also to fear
to pluck off or pull to pieces; causatively to supply with food (as in morsels)
a village (as covered in by walls); also a young lion (perhaps as covered with a mane)
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
properly, a concealer, i.e. a covert

13.brief: to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to project (one self), i.e. precede; hence, to anticipate, hasten, meet (usually for help)
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
to bend the knee; by implication, to sink, to prostrate
to slip out, i.e. escape; causatively, to deliver
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
drought; also a cutting instrument (from its destructive effect), as a knife, sword, or other sharp implement

14.brief: properly, an adult (as of full length); by implication, a man (only in the plural)
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, an adult (as of full length); by implication, a man (only in the plural)
life (as a fleeting portion of time); hence, the world (as transient)
properly, smoothness (of the tongue); also an allotment
alive; hence, raw (flesh); fresh (plant, water, year), strong; also (as noun, especially in the feminine singular and masculine plural) life (or living thing), whether literally or figuratively
to fill or (intransitively) be full of, in a wide application (literally and figuratively)
the belly, especially the womb; also the bosom or body of anything
to sate, i.e. fill to satisfaction (literally or figuratively)
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
to deposit; by implication, to allow to stay
properly, an overhanging, i.e. (by implication) an excess, superiority, remainder; also a small rope (as hanging free)

15.brief: the right (natural, moral or legal); also (abstractly) equity or (figuratively) prosperity
to gaze at; mentally to perceive, contemplate (with pleasure); specifically, to have avision of
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
to sate, i.e. fill to satisfaction (literally or figuratively)
something portioned (i.e. fashioned) out, as ashape, i.e. (indefinitely) phantom, or (specifically) embodiment, or (figuratively) manifestation (of favor)
